FuncDef:
The vbridge command adds a Remote-AP interface to a specified vBridge interface's vBridge broadcast domain.
The undo vbridge command deletes a Remote-AP interface from a vBridge broadcast domain.
By default, no Remote-AP is added to a vBridge broadcast domain.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of a vBridge interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When multiple base stations are located on the same network segment, Remote-AP interfaces still terminate VCs on an access ring. You must bind a vBridge interface to an L3VPN instance and run the vbridge command to add Remote-AP interfaces to a vBridge broadcast domain to implement multiple VCs' access to the same L3VPN.
Prerequisites
The following operations have been performed:
Run the interface vbridge command to create a vBridge interface.Run the interface remote-ap command to create a Remote-AP interface.Run the connect-slot command to associate the Remote-AP interface with a specified slot.

Precautions
In the same Remote-AP interface view, the vbridge command and the mpls l2vc encapsulation command are mutually exclusive.
